title: How's The Posting Number thang werk?

content: The post count is an automated system that is set by the server. It then translates the number of posts with a "tag" of your standing. Here is how the numbers break down: 0 to 249 posts = New Member 250 to 2999 posts = Member 3000 to 6999 posts = Experienced Member 7000 to 19999 posts = Highly Experienced Member 20000 to 34999 posts = Super Member 35000 + posts = Veteran Member Here is the kicker: If a member changes their screen, the system does not recognize this as a change of name by the same entity. It recognizes the new name as an entirely new entity, so it (the automated system) does not relate the existing post count with the new name. Instead, it starts over at zero. I hope this helps. "I know you believe you understand what you think I said, but I am not sure you realize that what you heard is not what I meant." - Oscar Wilde

It recognizes the new name as an entirely new entity, so it (the automated system) does not relate the existing post count with the new name. Instead, it starts over at zero. I hope this helps. content: You know.... Everyone can avoid the "tag" thing that is attached to your post count by having a "Custom Member Title" like the ones you see under my name, and the moderators and many other members. You can have just about anything under your screen name... as long as it's not too long and it's decent. If anyone has a particular request, just send me an email with your screen name and whatever you want to have as your "Custom Member Title". You can reach me directly at: Rob.Rodriguez@Military-inc.com Or you can contact your favorite moderator and he/she also has the ability to make it happen. "I know you believe you understand what you think I said, but I am not sure you realize that what you heard is not what I meant." - Oscar Wilde

title: How's The Posting Number thang werk?

content: The post count is an automated system that is set by the server. It then translates the number of posts with a "tag" of your standing. Here is how the numbers break down: 0 to 249 posts = New Member 250 to 2999 posts = Member 3000 to 6999 posts = Experienced Member 7000 to 19999 posts = Highly Experienced Member 20000 to 34999 posts = Super Member 35000 + posts = Veteran Member Here is the kicker: If a member changes their screen, the system does not recognize this as a change of name by the same entity. It recognizes the new name as an entirely new entity, so it (the automated system) does not relate the existing post count with the new name. Instead, it starts over at zero. I hope this helps. "I know you believe you understand what you think I said, but I am not sure you realize that what you heard is not what I meant." - Oscar Wilde

It recognizes the new name as an entirely new entity, so it (the automated system) does not relate the existing post count with the new name. Instead, it starts over at zero. I hope this helps. title: How's The Posting Number thang werk?

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: quote: Originally posted by majorjim: O.K. I just gotta ask. How does the "number of posts" thing work? As you can see I joined mil.com back in 2005. I like to read these posts and I've tried to keep up, but I haven't 'made a lot of posts' over the years, so my posting numbers are low. I've been watching the numbers box on many of your posts and they don't change even though you make a number of posts, some, one right after the other. Is this all explained in the TOS somewhere that I messed? They update at their own pace with some leg time on the various threads, but as I make this particular post, it will show the accurate number for itself... It used to be that if you erased a post, your number would descend. I erased nearly all the 2000+ posts I had as Three Bongo (which was dumb) and reduced the # under that moniker to almost zero. I also erased nearly 1400 GreyWolfGhost posts (even dumber). Had I not done those erasers...22,000 maybe!!! Almost a Super Member GW! Got money for everything but "VETERANS" Same old story!

content: You know.... Everyone can avoid the "tag" thing that is attached to your post count by having a "Custom Member Title" like the ones you see under my name, and the moderators and many other members. You can have just about anything under your screen name... as long as it's not too long and it's decent. If anyone has a particular request, just send me an email with your screen name and whatever you want to have as your "Custom Member Title". You can reach me directly at: Rob.Rodriguez@Military-inc.com Or you can contact your favorite moderator and he/she also has the ability to make it happen. "I know you believe you understand what you think I said, but I am not sure you realize that what you heard is not what I meant." - Oscar Wilde
